title: 111_s1527
content: The Act titled "Unsafe Meat and Poultry Recall Act" authorizes mandatory recalls for unsafe meat products under the Federal Meat Inspection Act. This includes notification, non-distribution, and recall of adulterated or misbranded meat products. The term 'meat product' is defined as carcass, part of a carcass, meat, or meat food product of an amenable species. Notification to the Secretary is required if a meat product is believed to be in violation of the Act, with exceptions for consumers and others exempted by regulation. The Secretary can order a voluntary non-distribution and recall if a meat product is found to be in violation of the Act. If a meat product is found to violate the Act and poses a threat to public health, the Secretary can instruct relevant parties to stop distribution, recall the product, and notify consumers. Failure to comply may result in mandatory actions by the Secretary. The Secretary can order a person to cease distribution of a meat product, notify others to do the same, and recall the product if it violates the Act and poses a health threat. Consumers must be notified of any mandatory actions taken. If notified, handlers of the meat product must stop distribution immediately. The Secretary can order a person to cease distribution of a meat product, recall it if it poses a health threat, and notify consumers and handlers. If grounds are inadequate, the mandatory actions required by an order can be vacated. Additional remedies are available under this section, and the definition of a person includes individuals, partnerships, corporations, associations, or other business units. The Secretary can order a person to cease distribution of a meat product, recall it if it poses a health threat, and notify consumers and handlers. Additional remedies are available under this section, and the definition of a person includes individuals, partnerships, corporations, associations, or other business units. Amendments include replacing "persons, firms, and corporations" with "persons" throughout the text. SEC. 32 of the Poultry Products Inspection Act allows for notification, non-distribution, and recall of adulterated, misbranded, and unsafe poultry products. SEC. 32 of the Poultry Products Inspection Act requires immediate notification to the Secretary if a person believes a poultry product violates the Act. Exceptions include consumers and those exempted by the Secretary. If a poultry product poses a health threat, the Secretary must initiate a voluntary recall. If a poultry product violates the Poultry Products Inspection Act and poses a health threat, the Secretary can require persons involved to cease distribution, recall the product, and notify consumers. If actions are not taken voluntarily, the Secretary can issue orders for immediate compliance. The Secretary can order persons handling a poultry product to cease distribution, recall the product, and notify consumers if it poses a health threat. Consumers must be informed of any mandatory actions taken. If necessary, a hearing can be held to determine the continuation of these actions. If mandatory actions required by an order are not followed, the Secretary can vacate the order. Additional remedies in this section are in addition to other available remedies under the law.
